task_summary: Scan, align, grasp the drawer handle, pull to open the drawer, then retreat and release.

task_long_description.overview: A Stretch-like mobile manipulator must open a wooden cabinet drawer visible beneath a dark countertop. The contact sheet shows the gripper approaching a horizontal bar handle on the drawer front, aligning beside the cabinet, and pulling the drawer open. The behavior first perceives and locates the handle, orients the tool to 90° yaw to match the bar, approaches with tight tolerance, grasps, and executes a container-open action specific to drawers. After the drawer is opened, the robot retreats slightly to avoid collision and releases the handle.
preconditions: Cabinet drawer and handle are within reachable workspace
No obstacles blocking approach along drawer pull direction
Robot base is stable; arm has free range of motion
Perception returns a detectable handle feature
stepwise_plan: Raster scan and detect the drawer handle.
Move to a pregrasp pose and set end-effector yaw to 90°.
Approach and align to the handle with tight tolerance; open gripper.
Compute grasp pose with a pull strategy and verify key availability.
Pick the handle and call the drawer open action.
Retreat slightly, then open gripper to release.
success_criteria: Drawer front translates outward creating a visible opening gap
Handle grasp remained stable during pull
No collisions with cabinet, fridge, or countertop
Robot retreats and releases the handle safely
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: repeat scan or adjust view
Misalignment: re-orient TCP to 90° and re-approach
Slip during pull: re-open, regrasp with new grasp pose
Drawer jam: attempt smaller pull distance or re-approach
task_long_description.termination: End when the drawer is reported open and the robot has retreated and released the handle.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector aligned near handle; first clear contact/pose check.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp expected followed by drawer pull.

node_specs.description: Active scan to localize the drawer handle.
Confirm visual detection of the handle.
Move arm/base to a pregrasp pose in front of drawer.
Rotate end-effector to match horizontal bar.
Close in and align to the handle precisely.
Compute a pull-oriented grasp pose on the handle.
Execute approach and close to grasp the handle.
Commanded pull to open the drawer.
Back off to clear the drawer front.

failure_modes: Incorrect end-effector yaw causing poor contact
recovery_strategy: Re-run SetTCPYaw and ApproachAndAlign with tighter tolerance
Recompute grasp pose and retry Pick
Shorter pull followed by second OpenContainer call
assumptions: Frames show a horizontal bar handle on a wooden drawer to the left of a fridge-like surface.
Pull direction is outward along the drawer axis; OpenContainer encapsulates the pull.
No explicit speed/force specified in instruction; default bins are used.

expected_success_criteria: Drawer extends outward visibly and consistently
No collisions with adjacent fridge or countertop
Handle remains in gripper until release
